alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Western Rutland (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 9:34PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...An area of heavy rain will impact portions of southern Rutland County through 1030 PM EDT... At 930 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of heavy rain over Wells, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Moderate to heavy rain, with rainfall rates approaching 1 inch per hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Small creeks and streams may rise sharply. Ponding of water on roadways and localized minor flooding in poor drainage areas will be possible. Locations impacted include... Rutland, Pawlet, Poultney Village, Mount Tabor, Tinmouth, Rutland City, Middletown Springs, Wallingford, Mt. Tabor, Danby, Lake St. Catherine, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Poultney, Clarendon, Ira, Wells, West Rutland, Shrewsbury, Mendon, and Fair Haven. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Turn around, don`t drown!
